raw_response: {"answer_index": 0, "answer_text": "Uncontrolled activation of macrophages and defects in the function of NK cells.", "confidence": 10, "reasoning": "Familial hemophagocytic lymphohistiocytosis (FHL) due to perforin deficiency leads to impaired cytotoxic function of NK cells and cytotoxic T lymphocytes, resulting in uncontrolled activation of macrophages. The other options do not describe the pathophysiology of perforin deficiency in FHL."}
